quotes.quote: Good intentions are not enough. They've never put an onion in the soup yet.
Good intentions never change anything. They only become a deeper and deeper rut.
As long as your intentions are solid and about growth and progression and being productive and not being idle, then you're doing good in my book.
A good intention is like the seed of a tree whose fruit we do not know.
Choose your intention carefully and then practice holding your consciousness to it, so it becomes the guiding light in your life.
Good intentions are very mortal and perishable things. Like very mellow and choice fruit, they are difficult to keep.
Good intentions are invariably ungrammatical.
Intention involves such a small fragment of our consciousness and of our mind and of our life.
We call an intention good which is right in itself, but the action is good, not because it contains within it some good, but because it issues from a good intention.
Intention is the core of all conscious life. Conscious intention colors and moves everything.
Intentions compressed into words enfold magical power.
Intention appears to be something akin to a tuning fork, causing the tuning forks of other things in the universe to resonate at the same frequency.
Every intention sets energy into motion whether you are conscious of it or not.
A good intention clothes itself with power.
Good intentions are useless until they are expressed in appropriate action!
Good intentions are only lies the weak tell themselves.
Good intentions are not enough; commitment and sacrifice are necessary.
A good intention, with a bad approach, often leads to a poor result.
Good intentions are not an excuse for maladministration of this magnitude
Good intentions are simply not enough. Our character is defined and our lives are determined not by what we want, say or think, but by what we do.
A good intention feeds no one.
The power of your intentions has a greater impact on your life than your actions.
Intentions of a man reflects in his actions.
Once your intentions are real and wise, helpful and positive, keep going forward. Never ever give up!
Intentions, whether good or bad, that don't reflect the words and actions are only meant to fulfill personal goals.
Intentions do not insulate us from the consequences of our actions.
Good intentions might sound nice, but it's positive actions that matter.
Intentions are nice, but ultimately intentions don't really matter because they only exist inside you.
Good intentions are no substitute for obedience.
Intentions often melt in the face of unexpected opportunity.
Let your intentions be good - embodied in good thoughts, cheerful words, and unselfish deeds - and the world will be to you a bright and happy place in which to work and play and serve
Good intentions are at least, the seed of good actions; and every one ought to sow them, and leave It to the soil and the seasons whether He or any other gather they fruit
Everything that happens in the universe begins with intention.
Setting your intention is like drawing an arrow from the quiver of your heart.
Great intentions become tragic action when delivered without careful thought.
Good intentions are the most beautiful of secrets.
